clinical_study.brief_title: Relationship Between Morbimortality and Basal Activated Clotting Time (ACT) in Patients Undergoing Vascular Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Relationship Between Morbimortality and Basal Activated Clotting Time (ACT) in Patients Undergoing Vascular Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: Fundació Institut de Recerca de l'Hospital de la Santa Creu i Sant Pau

clinical_study.source: Fundació Institut de Recerca de l'Hospital de la Santa Creu i Sant Pau

brief_summary.textblock: Check whether patients with higher comorbidity and risk of complication, estimated using the V (p) -POSSUM score, ACS NSQIP and the ASA classification, present higher baseline activated clotting time values.

primary_outcome.measure: Change on baseline Activated Clotting Time with comorbidities
primary_outcome.description: Activted Clotting Time will be measured with Haemocron Machine just before surgery. Comorbidities will be measured with V(p)Possum, AC NSQUIP and ASA scales.

intervention.description: Relationship between elongated baseline activated clotting time and comorbidity

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing vascular surgery consecutively in the first semester of 2021, for a period of one month, will be included.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing vascular surgery requiring intraoperative heparinization
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women
- SARS-CoV-2 PCR positive (performed 24-72h prior to surgery)
- Severe plaquetopenia <50,000
